greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the number of the proper divisors of n that are Lucas numbers larger than 3 (4, 7, 11, 18, ...).
comment: a(n) is the number of the proper divisors d of n that are of the form d = A000045(k-1) + A000045(k+1), for k >= 3.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
example: The proper divisors of 28 are 1, 2, 4, 7 and 14. Of these 4 and 7 are Lucas numbers (A000032) larger than 3, thus a(28) = 2.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 13 2018
